channel.title: Repp ++ Making a compiler
channel.description: I was wondering if anyone knew a quick and easy way to create a compiler for the source files. I have downloaded a server with no compiler and I need one to obviously compile, and this server has like 100 folders implemented into it and its taking ages to create a compiler and 1 little mistake will fuck it all up, so i was wondering if anyone knew how to create on easy and simple and fast maybe but as long as it was reliable ill use it.

item.title: Repp ++ Making a compiler
item.dc:creator: @kill_you704 kill you704
item.description:
@kill_you704 wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:8, topic:432687”]umm try this

@echo off Title Compiler C:\Program Files\Java\YOUR VERSION OF JAVA\java.exe" *java pause[/quote]
This is as if you had a unorganized client with all your class and java files all in the same folder. And, i’m talking about source files lol, but thanks anyways man.

Read full topic

item.title: Repp ++ Making a compiler
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

@halflive9
LOL, really because it says source files in this case means all the files and the compiler does compile everything

kill you704:

I was wondering if anyone knew a quick and easy way to create a compiler for the source files. I have downloaded a server with no compiler and I need one to obviously compile

item.title: Repp ++ Making a compiler
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

just do:
cd /Where-ever-the-location-of-it-is/
javac *.java

Read full topic

item.title: Repp ++ Making a compiler
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:8, topic:432687”]umm try this

@echo off Title Compiler C:\Program Files\Java\YOUR VERSION OF JAVA\java.exe" *java pause[/quote]
This is not what he mean. The problem is he has a lot of different maps so he need to add them all in the compiler so they will get compiled.

Read full topic

item.description:
@kill_you704 wrote:

xxxtilllyxxx:

Eclipse comples your java source code for you, it also shows problems with code, uncalled int’s and errors too. It’s really good if you already know java./

Okay, the past 3 hours I’ve been learning how to use eclipse. Thanks alot guys.

[/quote]
What does eclipse do?[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Integrated development environment

An integrated development environment (IDE) is a software application that provides comprehensive facilities to computer programmers for software development. An IDE normally consists of a source code editor, build automation tools, and a debugger. Most modern IDEs have intelligent code completion. Some IDEs, such as NetBeans and Eclipse, contain a compiler, interpreter, or both; others, such as SharpDevelop and Lazarus, do not. The boundary between an integrated development environment and other...
